node.name: Show Node for introspection
node.description: This is the default node when connecting to the VTY interface. This node does not require any additional permission and allows to introspect the application.

node.name: Enable Node for admin commands
node.description: This is a privileged node allowing to make changes to the configuration and allow to access more commands. Everything available on the show node should be available here.

node.name: Configuration Node for configuration
node.description: This is the base node for all configuration nodes. It allows to enter BTS and logging node to configure them.

node.name: Logging Node for logging configuration
node.description: This is the node is a child of the configuration node and is responsible for configuring the logging framework including the log targets and log levels.

node.name: E1/J1/T1 Configuration Node
node.description: This is the configuration for E1/J1/T1/IP configuration for mISDN, DAHDI or IP based connectivity.

command.description: The logging framework has the concept of filters. This can be used to only show log messages that apply to a given timeslot or subscriber. The all filter allows all messages to pass unfiltered.
